definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

pinyin: Shang4 hai3 Shang1 wu4 yin4 shu1 guan3

sentences.english: The book was published by the Commercial Press.
sentences.chinese: 該書由商務印書館出版。

sentences.english: She has recently published her fourth book with the Commercial Press.
sentences.chinese: 她最近在商務印書館出版了她的第四本專著。

sentences.english: A new English-Chinese dictionary is to be brought out by the Commercial Press in the near future.
sentences.chinese: 商務印書館準備在不久出版一本新的英漢詞典。

sentences.english: He has published many works through (with) the Commercial Press.
sentences.chinese: 他在商務印書館出版了許多作品。

definition: Joint Publishing, bookstore chain and publisher, founded in Hong Kong in 1948
printing plate bearing an image (illustration, photo etc)/print made with such a plate
a series of books/a collection of books
books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
to refer to/see also/compare (cf.)/to pay respect to
Taibei or Taipei, capital of Taiwan
